review: Here is the deal with this item.  It allows you to turn your phone, tablet, or computer into a "nerve center".  When I got this item, I thought it was going to be the same as roku or apple tv.  It will allow you to turn your phone, computer, tablet into a delivery system, but that is all.  It takes your content on those devices, and streams it.  When you look at the other two devices, it actually has apps that connect directly to the computer so that you don't need another app.  I figure that it does work as far as you only have your phone, your tablet, or other and you want to stream to the tv with it plugged in, but in all, it did not live up to the hype that I had heard from the commercials.
author: Malcolm

review: I bought this because I had heard lots of great hype about it and at just $35, how could I not try it?  Installation was easy enough, although a little oversimplified to the point that minor details on how to actually use it were omitted.  I don't recall the device telling me that there would be an icon at the top-right of my Netflix app.  But that only took a minute to figure out.  Using it with my iPhone is a breeze and an awesome experience.  Not only being able to toggle captioning without pausing the movie, but I'm also able to close the app and use my phone normally without interrupting the stream.  So far, flawless in that respect.HOWEVER, when you're not using it, unplug it.  That sucker gets HOT.  I don't know if it's an issue with mine or what but keep an eye on that.I'm happy with it, overall.  But I feel like it could do more and from what I understand, there should soon be support for local media.  We'll see.  In the meantime, it's a low price tag and while it does very little, it is very good at the little it does.
